intro: Aeschynanthus rhododendron, commonly known as the red-tipped pelargonium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking red-tipped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for containers and garden beds.
